events.title: Extraordinary Founders Dinner
events.location: Yeung, Drew Parten, Bo Weathersbee, Lindsay Atkeson & 1 otherNew York, New York
events.description: ​ Hi, Andrew Yeung & Lindsay Atkeson here. ​ On February 10th, we are bringing together ambitious founders and builders from around the world for dinner at our favorite Chinese restaurant. ​ We both grew up in Asia (Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai), and want to bring together the extraordinary founders who are building in NYC. ​ Apply below! ​ ​​ What to expect: ​ ​​ A 3-course meal , courtesy of our partners ​ Conversations with fellow high-performing startup leaders ​ ​​ Meaningful connections with ambitious peers who know what it's like to build in a new country ​ ​​If you're wondering how our dinners usually go... read this ​ Our only intent is to bring good, smart humans together. ​ ​​ Details: ​ ​​📅 Date: February 10, 2026 ​ ​⏰ Time: 6:30pm - 8:30pm ​ ​🍽️ Venue: Private Dinner Club in NYC ​ Past attendees of my events include the founders/C-suite of Venmo, Duolingo, Foursquare, Lyft, Goldman Sachs, Compass, Superhuman, Yext, OpenDoor, Chief, LearnVest, DocSend, Vercel, Loom, Morning Brew, The Hustle, Gas, Teachable, Replit, Twitter, Slack, Pinterest, Yahoo, MongoDB, Business Insider, Wonder, Hinge. ​ ​​👉 Apply to join by filling out the RSVP form. ​ About our Hosts & Sponsors: ​ 🎩 ​ ​ Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe and The Shortlist NYC . He is also an angel investor and Partner at Next Wave NYC , a pre-seed venture fund. Andrew has hosted over 300 events for 50,000 founders, operators, investors, and tech professionals that were featured by Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, Fortune Magazine, Axios, Newsweek, and Forbes. Business Insider dubbed him the " Gatsby of Silicon Alley. " ​ 👩‍🏫 Lindsay Atkeson is an Investor at Outsiders Fund , a Seed & Series A fund started by Austin McChord, Founder of Datto (NYSE: MSP; subsequent $6B+ take-private). Outsiders Fund was launched as a spinout from General Catalyst to invest in founders bringing new perspectives to industries plagued by stale or antiquated infrastructure. ​ ​​​​ Rho is the all-in-one banking platform for startups. With banking set up in minutes, 2% cashback cards, and powerful tools for managing spend, paying bills, and closing the books, Rho helps high-growth startups move fast and stay focused—with support that goes to the ends of the earth to help you win. ​ Till CFO provides top-tier fractional financial leadership, day-to-day financial operations (accounting, FP&A, etc.), and CFO advisory to early-stage SaaS, AI, FinTech, and Services businesses. They tailor their services to align with each client’s unique needs, delivering expert financial stewardship to founders, CEOs, and operators at the Seed stage and beyond. ​ Schedule a free 1-hour session with Till's Founder & CEO, Bo Weathersbee, a 5x founder and seasoned CFO. Use this time to discuss strategy, address challenges, and explore the optimal finance stack for your company. ​ Manifest Law is a modern immigration law firm built for founders, startups, and fast-growing companies. Manifest specializes in securing visas and work authorization for immigrant entrepreneurs and top global talent, helping companies navigate complex U.S. immigration pathways with speed, clarity, and a startup-first mindset—so builders can focus on scaling, not paperwork.

events.title: Somartica
events.description: ​ Somartica: Where movement meets creativity & Presence meets play ​ What happens when adults remember their most embodied, creative selves? ​ Join us for an evening where meditation melts into movement , movement makes way to art , and before you know it, you're drawing on the walls, rolling on the ground belly laughing , and connecting with yourself and others in true authenticity and joy . ​ Somartica blends somatics with art through research-backed methods that help quiet your mind , settle your nervous system , and get you into flow . ​ No performance. No perfection. Just presence and play . ​ The evening’s journey: ✨ A grounding meditation to help you arrive and land 🌀 Intuitive, guided movement to awaken your body’s innate intelligence 🎨 Creative expression through all manner of materials (Crayons! Paint! Yarn! Etc!) 🤸🏽‍♀️ Pure, unscripted play where we find ourselves + one another 🌿 A closing circle to help integrate the magic ​ Consider this your permission slip to be totally who you are ... and surrounded by people doing the same. ❣️ ​ What people are saying: "Somartica is a blast. " "I was out of my head and in a silly flow state the whole time!" ​ No experience necessary. Whether you're a seasoned artist and mover or total beginner, you are welcome. ​ Can't wait to see you! ​ Wear clothes you can move in. ​ Led By: Nasimeh Be ​ Nasimeh Be is an artist, facilitator, and coach with a decade of experience blending mindfulness, mental health, and creativity. Her work has been featured in venues as varied as the Walt Disney Concert Hall, Buzzfeed, and The Rumpus. A trained yoga teacher, improviser, and coach, Nasimeh brings her deep knowledge of mindfulness and play to create transformative, joyful experiences. ​ She is currently pursuing an M.A. in Spiritual Psychology at Columbia. You are welcome to find out more about her across social media: @NasimehBE ​ ​*** ​ Come Early to Elevate Your Experience with Adaptogenic Foods and Teas ​ Reforesters Laboratory is an experimental adaptogenic cafe and sound clinic located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. We utilize music – including spatial, sub-bass-centered, and organic instrumentation – along with breathwork, meditation, art, plant care and adaptogenic, nutritional foods + beverages to cultivate kindness—both physical and spiritual. We aim to create an environment that offers peace, space, and clarity, helping people understand the connections between themselves, their communities, and the world around them. To that end, we offer affordable "pay what you can" ticket options on all events and classes.

events.title: From Engineer to Founder: Building and Selling Developer Tools with Extend & Authzed
events.location: Daniel Chesley, Darren Chow, Extend & 2 othersNew York, New York
events.description: ​ Cofounders.nyc & Work-Bench are excited to host a fireside chat with Kushal Byatnal, Co-Founder & CEO of Extend , and Jake Moshenko , Co-Founder & CEO of Authzed for an intimate night of lessons learned and the future of agentic software. ​ We’ll go deep on Extend & Authzed's founding stories, Kushal and Jake's transitions from engineer to founder, and the lessons learned along the way from finding product-market fit and cracking go-to-market, to fundraising and building with AI inside a complex enterprise landscape. Expect candid insights, honest tradeoffs, and plenty of room for discussion. ​ This is a small, curated gathering designed to foster real conversation and high-signal connections with other NYC founders and operators building ambitious companies. ​ 🗓️ Wednesday February 11th 🕰️ 6:00PM – 8:00PM ET 📍 In-person, NYC (location shared upon confirmation) ​ Space is limited — please register and we’ll follow up to confirm your spot. ​ This event is brought to you by: Extend : Extend is an AI-native document processing infrastructure company helping ambitious technical teams transform unstructured documents into high-quality structured data with accuracy and speed. Their platform provides a complete suite of APIs and tooling for parsing, extraction, classification, and workflow orchestration, enabling engineers to build and deploy production-ready document workflows in days. Extend works with cutting-edge companies across industries to accelerate product roadmaps and unlock the full value of mission-critical data. They've raised $17M from investors like Innovation Endeavors, Homebrew, and Guillermo Rauch. ​ AuthZed is on a mission to fix access control by providing authorization infrastructure. AuthZed provides one authorization system for your entire application ecosystem, eliminating authorization silos and simplifying your architecture with a centralized permissions platform. Trusted by developer and platform teams at OpenAI, Workday, National Bank of Canada, Turo, Neo Financial and more. ​ Work-Bench : We are an early stage enterprise software VC fund based in New York City. We lead $3M - $6M Seed rounds in SaaS and infrastructure startups, focus on supporting companies’ 0 to 1 go-to-market journeys, and have built a dynamic enterprise tech community here in NYC. We’re investing out of our $160M Fund IV, and notable portfolio companies include Cockroach Labs, Socure, Spring Health, and Dialpad. cofounders.nyc is a curated community for NYC's top builders. The goal is to connect top operators, so you can build the next big thing. Whether you're looking for a co-founder or early teammate, cofounders.nyc is here to help. cofounders.nyc is run by Danny Chesley . ​ Ramp is the leading financial management platform (cards, bill pay, T&E, and treasury) to help startups stretch their runway and scale efficiently. VC-backed founders use Ramp to cut their costs and spend smarter with real-time visibility & tight control over every dollar, saving ~5% on all expenses. Through our partnership with Ramp, your team receives: ​ $1,000 sign-up bonus ​ $350K+ in startup perks, including credits from AWS, Azure, Cognition, OpenAI, Notion, and more ​ White-glove onboarding support and expedited underwriting ​ To Redeem: sign up here .

events.title: BAD BUNNY Vinyasa Refresh + Jazz Social ​🎷 (Park Slope)
events.description: ​ 🧘‍♀️ BAD BUNNY FLOW - Vinyasa Refresh + Jazz Social ​ 🎷 ​ 🎶 Flowing vinyasa practice set to Bad Bunny + live jazz after 🌊 Style: All levels flow (accessible and revivifying) 🙏 No yoga experience needed. Ideal for beginners and experienced yogis. We mean it!! ​ 📣 How to Sign Up Register on Luma and present your ticket at the door. Or just walk in. We always love our walk ins (pay by credit card). BYOM (Bring Your Own Mat) or rent one from us for $5. ​ 📍 Where & When Time: Doors open at 6:30 PM. The meeting begins once the room fills, usually about 15 to 20 minutes after. The yoga practice runs for about one hour. Live jazz schmooze follows. ​ 🌿 What to Expect We are a club, not a class. Come as you are, say hello to the people around you, and settle in. ​ This Bad Bunny Flow is part of our Vinyasa Refresh series and runs about an hour. Expect to move and breathe through an energizing set of standing postures and rejuvenating poses on the floor, all set to Bad Bunny tracks that keep the flow fun and grounded. ​ We understand that life happens. Sometimes that means showing up late, in your PJs, or both. We leave some time at the beginning of our meetings to ease in and socialize. ​ 🎷 After Yoga Stick around. There will be live jazz downstairs and a cash bar with snacks for us to enjoy after practice. ​ ⭐ Our Instructor Dan Sohval came to yoga seeking ways to build inner discipline and mental balance. He is the founder of Yoga Club, which has grown to over 1500 members since launching in 2025. A lifelong educator, he brings to his instruction the same humor and curiosity that guides his teaching in the classroom. He received his 200 hour certification at VeraYoga with additional training in yin and trauma informed practices. Off the mat, he is a published author, teaches computer science, and is an avid fan of Korean food. ​ 💫 About Yoga Club We bring people together through high quality, affordable yoga and community. We meet in creative spaces around the city to move, breathe, and meet new people.

events.title: New York Fashion Week : Made With Intention
events.location: henry, 99 YARDS, Inside Fashion Design & Digital Fashion WeekNew York, New York
events.description: ​ Made With Intention: Sustainability Mixer & Panel Discussion New York Fashion Week Opening Night ​ Join us for Made With Intention , a New York Fashion Week opening-night mixer and panel discussion centered on sustainability, innovation, and purpose-driven fashion. This event brings together forward-thinking brands, educators, and emerging talent who are actively shaping a more responsible and intentional future for the fashion industry. ​ Hosted by ​ 99 YARDS is a fashion-tech platform connecting brands, creatives, and services to streamline fashion campaigns, portfolio building, and collaboration across the global fashion ecosystem. ​ Inside Fashion Design is a multimedia platform and resource hub dedicated to helping fashion professionals learn, grow, create, and connect in the industry. It provides curated education, industry insights, design resources, mentorship, community connections, and events to support conscious and sustainable fashion careers and businesses. The platform fosters a global community where designers, entrepreneurs, and creatives can access tools, collaborations, and professional development opportunities to advance in fashion and make a positive impact ​ What to Expect ​ ​ Networking Mixer, Panel Discussions,& t ech Activation Connect with designers, students, brands, and fashion-tech professionals who are passionate about sustainability, ethical production, and intentional design. ​ Royalty Radio & Customer XR present: Metaverse to Reality Fashion Show , an immersive experience inside Meta Horizon where the NYC fashion industry steps into a live digital runway. Featuring real designers and real people embodied ​ Join our 50/50 Raffle and be part of the impact! One lucky winner will take home 50% of the raffle proceeds , plus a swag bag filled with curated goodies . ​ Your participation directly supports Inside Fashion Design , a nonprofit dedicated to providing education, resources, and community for fashion industry professionals—helping build a more thoughtful, sustainable, and connected fashion industry. ​ Win something great. Support something meaningful.  Click the link below to participate. ​ https://go.rallyup.com/createwithintenton ​ YOUR HOST ​ Tony Henry - Founder and CEO of 99 YARDS ​ ​ ​ Britta (Sautter) Cabanos - Founder | Fashion Educator & Community Builder ​ ​ Brand Panel : Sustainable Fashion in Practice ​ Hear from sustainability-driven fashion brands as they share their journeys, challenges, and approaches to building intentional collections and responsible production models. ​ Moderate by Karen Zhang ​ ​ Karen Zhang is a product marketing leader and advisor specializing in fashion and consumer technology. With experience across companies including eBay, RetailMeNot, Sephora, and Condé Nast, she brings deep expertise in brand storytelling, go-to-market strategy, and consumer insight. Karen holds an MBA from Duke University. ​ Featured Brands Panelist : ​ ZIPEL NYC ​ ZIPÉL NYC is a New York–born fashion brand blending bold artistic expression with the heritage of denim. Since its founding, the label has built a reputation for creating unique, handcrafted, and limited-edition denim pieces that blend sophistication with street culture, encouraging wearers to express confidence and individuality. The brand emphasizes innovation and sustainability , offering responsibly sourced materials and community-oriented programs like denim recycling initiatives. ​ KAJAL New York ​ Kajal New York is a luxury womenswear brand rooted in craftsmanship, sustainability, and intentional design . Based in New York City, the label creates modern silhouettes from repurposed and ethical fabrics , producing limited runs meant to be worn, re-worn, and kept in circulation. Its design philosophy prioritizes timeless pieces that minimize environmental impact and elevate thoughtful wardrobe investment. ​ KRAVC ​ KRAVC is a fashion label founded by Katrin Kravc with a mission to represent women through sophistication, elegance, and individuality . Drawing on over 15 years of global fashion experience, the brand crafts handmade luxury pieces that celebrate refined form and personal confidence. While not exclusively sustainability-positioned, KRAVC emphasizes quality craftsmanship and original design that honors legacy and individual expression. ​ Education & Industry Panel ​ Gain insights from leading fashion educators who are advancing sustainability through education, research, and industry engagement, featuring: ​ Moderate by CLARE TATTERSALL - CEO Digital Fashion Week ​ Digital Fashion Week , a global platform redefining how fashion is presented and experienced through technology. Digital Fashion Week champions innovation at the intersection of fashion, digital culture, and emerging technologies, creating new opportunities for designers, brands, and creatives to showcase work beyond traditional runway formats. Through immersive experiences, global programming, and a future-forward approach, Digital Fashion Week is shaping the next era of the fashion industry. ​ Panelist ​ Jill Stein — Instructor, Vogue College of Fashion ​ Jill Stein is a fashion educator and luxury fashion consultant who teaches at the Vogue College of Fashion, where she leads an immersive curriculum that encourages students to think critically, creatively, and ethically about the fashion industry. She brings decades of experience across fashion and media, guiding emerging talent to build sustainable, intentional practices and brand concepts as they enter the industry. ​ ​ Michael Ferraro — Fashion Institute of Technology (FIT) ​ Michael (FIT faculty) represents the educational strength of the Fashion Institute of Technology , one of the world’s leading fashion schools. FIT’s curriculum spans design, business, technology, and creative media, preparing students for careers that influence how fashion is designed, produced, and understood globally. ​ ​ Liliana Sanguino-Ramirez, PhD -The New SchoolParson ​ Liliana Sanguino-Ramirez, Ph.D. Professor of Fashion Design & Social Justice and the Donna Karan Co-Director of the MFA Fashion Design & Society program at Parsons School of Design, The New School. She is a globally recognized fashion educator, researcher, and creative practitioner whose work centers on decolonial pedagogy, community-based collaborative research, and intercultural learning within design education. ​ ​ 📲 Stay Connected Join our WhatsApp community for real-time updates on NYC fashion, fashion tech, creator events, mixers, panels, and pop-ups. ​ Interactive Q&A Engage directly with panelists to explore practical, actionable insights for your own projects, studies, or career path. ​ Community Engagement Discover opportunities to collaborate, contribute, and grow within the fashion and fashion-tech ecosystem. ​ Whether you’re a student, creative professional, educator, or brand innovator , Made With Intention offers a platform to connect, learn, and celebrate fashion with purpose.

events.title: Double Diamond ft. Carl Rivera, Chief Design Officer at Shopify
events.location: Falcone, Chase Goulet & Alex PavlouNew York, New York
events.description: ​ Double Diamond is back for our first interview of 2026, featuring Carl Rivera , Chief Design Officer at Shopify . Rivera leads design for one of the world's largest commerce platforms and developing a distinct vision for how design teams navigate the AI era. ​ About Carl Rivera ​ Carl Rivera is Chief Design Officer at Shopify, where he's reimagining how design works in the age of AI. As a former startup founder, he brings an entrepreneurial lens to leading one of tech's largest design teams through this transformation. ​ Rivera has developed a clear philosophy about AI and design. In 2025, he eliminated "UX Designer" and "Content Designer" titles at Shopify. "If you design, you're a Designer. If you write, you're a Writer," he declared. Rivera believes AI will make baseline design skills ubiquitous, forcing human designers to focus on what algorithms can't replicate. "We hire for taste. For aesthetics. For a point-of-view. It's the difference between utility and affinity," he explains. He's currently experimenting with interfaces where users can "shift between talking, typing, clicking, and even drawing" with AI that anticipates needs "like the most brilliant partner you could dream of." ​ Audience & Curation ​ Every Double Diamond event is intentionally curated . We're prioritizing product builders and design leaders who are actively working with AI in their practice, whether that's incorporating AI tools into their workflow, designing AI-native experiences, or managing teams through this transition. In the case of this event with Carl, we're going to give particular priority to people managers and those currently tasked with overseeing the creation of AI-driven experiences and the implementation of AI-assisted design practices at scale . ​ Recording & Sharing ​ This conversation will be professionally recorded and attendees will receive a link to the full recording in the days following the event. Feel free to use clips however you'd like - on social, in presentations, or for team discussions. We always appreciate you tagging Double Diamond when you share! ​ Agenda ​ 6:00 - 7:00 Arrivals and mingling ​ 7:00- ~7:45 Conversation with Carl Rivera ​ 7:45 - Late Open mingling ​ Sponsors ​ Double Diamond events are produced with the support of 28th&Park , who helps founders, VCs, musicians, artists, and community builders create content effortlessly by owning all production and post-production from their studio in Flatiron or on location. ​ Double Diamond ​ This event is hosted by Double Diamond , a live-in-NYC event and content series for product and design practitioners building with AI right now . Double Diamond curates intimate, long-form conversations with the builders shaping these novel experiences, and pairs these conversations with a carefully selected audience of peers who ask the right questions and often are wrestling with the same ones. ​ Follow us on Substack , Linkedin , and Twitter to keep up with our events and conversations.

events.title: NeuroNYC Fireside Chat + Happy Hour: The State of Jobs in Neurotech | February 12th
events.location: Charles Rodenkirch, George Kenefati, Louis Zhao & 2 othersKings County, New York
events.description: ​ Join us for an exciting evening of conversation and connection at NeuroNYC Happy Hour! This in-person mixer brings together innovators, researchers, investors, and enthusiasts at the intersection of neuroscience and technology. We’re thrilled to feature a fireside chat on the State of Jobs & Hiring in Neurotech (2026) - a candid conversation spanning both sides of the market, from industry leaders who are hiring to recruiters speaking directly with candidates. We’ll cover what’s changing in hiring right now, the roles and skills teams are prioritizing, and what job seekers should know as the field evolves. Featured speakers include Chay Carter ( Carter Sciences ; and recently launched recruiting software Reccy !), alongside Conor Russomanno (founder and CEO of OpenBC I). Moderated by Margot Hanley , PhD! Event Agenda: 6:00 - 6:30 PM: Check-in & Networking 6:30 - 7:00 PM: Fireside Chat — The State of Jobs & Hiring in Neurotech (2026) 7:00 - 9:00 PM: Open Networking ​ Whether you’re building, investing in, or researching neurotech, this is the place to meet like-minded peers, exchange ideas, and grow your network. Past attendees include professionals from OpenBCI, Synchron, Sharper Sense, Mount Sinai, and more. ​ 📍 Location ​ The event will take place in Greenpoint, Brooklyn . Registered attendees will receive the exact location details prior to the event. About NeuroNYC NeuroNYC is a community of neurotech enthusiasts, researchers, founders, and investors across NYC. Our goal is to foster connection and conversation across the growing neurotech ecosystem by hosting happy hours, fireside chats, and community-driven events. We’re excited by the rapid growth of neurotechnology in NYC and aim to create spaces where people across companies, labs, and disciplines can connect, learn, and collaborate. ​ 🔗 Website: https://neuro-nyc.org ​ 💬 Join our Slack community: https://join.slack.com/t/neuronyc/shared_invite/zt-2ofy9y8i8-4PQTrAlWseyx3Lb~3wfwig ​ 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/neuronyc/ ​ 🎟️ Tickets The event is free to attend. There is no cost to attend our events, but donations are greatly appreciated! Funds go directly toward improving events, expanding networking opportunities, and developing free resources for members. https://collect.bankingcrowded.com/collection/e751c7f5-8ec2-401f-9632-c576863b922f

events.title: NYC Neurodivergent Networking Evening ✨
events.location: that quirky bird girl, Edwin Portugal & StephNew York, New York
events.description: ​ Join us for a welcoming, low-pressure, joy-filled evening designed for neurodivergent professionals— by neurodivergent-led communities . ​ This isn’t traditional networking. There’s no forced small talk, no awkward room-scanning, and no pressure to perform. ​ Instead, we’ll use a simple color-matching system to help guide conversations—so you can connect at your own pace, in ways that feel safe, natural, and genuinely enjoyable. ​ Come as you are. Connect how you want. Stay as long (or short) as feels right. ​ 🎨 How It Works ​ At the start of the event, you’ll be assigned a color . ​ That color becomes your gentle social signal for the evening. You’re invited to notice and connect with others who share your color —using the match as an easy, natural way to start conversation. ​ To support connection (and reduce social guesswork), you’ll also receive optional conversation prompts you can use as starters. These are there to guide you, not box you in—use them as much or as little as you’d like. ​ There’s no pressure to circulate, perform, or meet everyone. You can: ​ Stay with one conversation ​ Move at your own pace ​ Take breaks whenever you need ​ The goal isn’t networking harder—it’s connecting more comfortably , with clarity, consent, and kindness. ✨ ​ 🌈 About Our Hosts ​ That Quirky Bird Girl ​ I’m a neurodivergent creator and community builder designing neurodivergent-safe events across NYC . Since September, I’ve hosted 600+ attendees and reached 500,000+ people through my online content. Now, I’m bringing those virtual skills into physical spaces—creating warm, affirming environments grounded in joy, curiosity, nature, and genuine human connection. Come as you are, please. ​ LikeYou ​ A Pennsylvania-based startup transforming mental health and life outcomes for neurodivergent adults — starting with the 5+ million autistic and 15+ million ADHD adults in the U.S. ​ Their approach is: ​ Neurodiversity-affirming ​ Community-driven ​ Cost-effective ​ Backed by research & lived experience ​ They recently launched a virtual coaching pilot program for autistic and ADHD adults, offering practical support in: organization, time management, communication, self-advocacy, and goal-setting — delivered by certified neurodiversity-trained coaches. ​ ​ Mentra ​ A San Francisco–based neurodivergent hiring platform and network. Mentra is building a future where neurodivergent talent is valued, supported, and matched with workplaces that truly understand ND needs. They champion inclusive hiring and career growth through their tech platform and expansive community. ​ Download our app here ! ​ 💫 Who This Event Is For ​ Autistic adults ​ ADHD & AuDHD professionals ​ Neurodivergent creatives, founders, career-switchers, and students ​ Folks building community in NYC ​ Anyone looking for a safe, affirming place to socialize ​ People staying local for the holidays and craving connection ​ All neurotypes welcome — we only ask that you approach with kindness, curiosity, and openness. ​ 💛 Stay Connected ​ ✨ Join the That Quirky Bird Girl weekly newsletter: Subscribe Here ​ ​Curious what TQBG past events look like? Check out our community moments and bird sightings! 👉 View the Gallery: See Photos ​ ​🎧 Find Steph on Spotify | Apple Podcasts | TikTok | YouTube | LinkedIn ​ 📬 Accessibility or questions: thatquirkybirdgirl@gmail.com ​ ​ This is a 21+ event only, thank you for understanding

events.title: NEW INC Y13 Open House
events.description: ​ NEW INC’s Open Call is live from February 2–March 2, 2026! ​ Join us for our annual Open House, a hybrid information session for creative practitioners interested in applying for NEW INC's next cohort. ​ Get to know the NEW INC team, learn more about what it is like to participate in our program, and experience NEW INC’s partner XR studio, Onassis ONX. This session is meant to be conversational and intended to be interactive. After NEW INC’s presentation, you will have a chance to ask all your questions to the NEW INC team. We hope you’ll take us up on the invitation to meet you. ​ RSVP to join either virtually or in-person. ​ About the hosts: ​ As the first museum-born cultural incubator, NEW INC was conceived of as a not-for-profit platform to further the New Museum’s ongoing commitment to new art and new ideas. Now in its twelfth year, NEW INC’s membership model continues to support a diverse range of creative practitioners with a values-driven program and safe space for gathering and developing new creative projects and businesses. In 2020, NEW INC launched ONX Studio, an XR accelerator for artists, in partnership with the Onassis Foundation. NEW INC was cofounded by the New Museum’s Toby Devan Lewis Director Lisa Phillips and former Deputy Director Karen Wong in 2014. ​ Onassis ONX is the Onassis Foundation’s global platform for art and advanced technologies. As a catalyst for digital cultures, it supports genre-defying new media and immersive projects while also bolstering a network of institutions and industries ready to respond to new forms of creative expression. The modular infrastructure that Onassis ONX builds enables experimentation and circulation, fostering innovative works that meaningfully engage with audiences around the world.

events.description: ​ "Why are there no coffeeshops open late? But what if I want to co-work at night?!?" - everyone on Twitter ​ We are so excited to present, Cafe Compute. The late night pop-up coffeeshop from SF is going all out Lunar New Year with a coffee cart ☕️, dumplings 🥟, fortune cookies 🥠, and red envelopes 🧧. ​ ​​​​​This event is brought to you by Cerebras , Modal , Browserbase , and Replit. ​ ​ Cerebras is the world’s fastest AI inference, up to 15x faster than leading GPUs. Cerebras Inference is powered by our Wafer-Scale Engine (WSE-3) - the world's largest AI chip. Explore our newest open-source model, GLM 4.7, and get free compute at cerebras.ai . Browserbase is the AI infrastructure purpose-built for web agents. Build brand new products or turn ancient manual workflows into automations with an easy to use browser API. It's time for AI to browse the web like humans and unlock millions of hours of manual work. Get 3 months free when you sign up with code CAFECOMPUTE . Modal is AI infrastructure developers love. Run high-performance inference, training, and batch processing on one platform. Access GPU compute with sub-second cold starts, instant autoscaling,  and a developer experience that feels local.

events.title: The Future of NYC’s Skyline
events.location: Real Estate Club & REA New York64 Wooster St
events.description: ​ The IE NYC Real Estate Club and REA New York present: ​ The Future of NYC’s Skyline Building, Financing, and Managing the Vertical City ​ Join us for an exclusive panel exploring how New York City’s skyline is being shaped today and what lies ahead. ​ Humberto Lopes, CEO of H.L Dynasty ​ Lawrence Bremer, Senior Vice President at Moinian ​ Cara Riordan, Vice President at Bank of America ​ Genessy Jaramillo, NAOIP NYC Metro´s Executive Board and MD at BKREA ​ Moderated by Dmitri Shuster, IENYC Faculty Chair and Program Director ​ This event brings together leaders across development, investment, and finance to offer a multi perspective view on the forces transforming New York City’s built environment. ​ Our speakers will share their first hand experience on how large scale projects are conceived, financed, and executed, addressing the critical question of how to navigate and succeed in an increasingly vertical, complex, and capital intensive city. ​ The discussion will move from personal career paths and professional insights to a forward looking conversation on where opportunities lie in today’s market and how the next generation of real estate leaders can position themselves to help shape NYC’s future. ​ Agenda: ​ 17:30 – Opening & Registration ​ 17:45 – Welcome by IE NYC and REA NYC ​ 18:00 – The Future of NYC´s Skyline ​ 19:00 – Q&A ​ 19:15 – Networking Session with Food & Drinks ​ 20:30 – Closing ​ Whether you are pursuing a career in real estate, finance, or development or looking to expand your professional network, this event offers a unique opportunity to engage directly with industry leaders operating at the highest level of New York City real estate. ​ Join us for an evening of valuable insights and connections as we explore how the future skyline of New York is built, financed, and transformed. ​ Dress Code: Business Formal

events.title: Cycol Gallery presents SEEN: featuring Sen2, Elle, and Dain
events.location: Liss, Skyline, BONK!!! & Harris LobelCycol Gallery
events.description: ​ SEEN explores visibility — who is seen, how they are seen, and what it takes to be remembered. For Sen2, Elle, and Dain, being seen is earned through time, repetition, and presence in the city, where street and studio blur and marks become identity. The work reflects both the artist and the viewer, capturing moments that demand attention rather than ask for it. Once seen, it cannot be unseen. ​ Featuring the work of legendary artists Sen2, Elle, and Dain. ​ With a special preview at Solana Accelerate in Hong Kong ​ Curated by Harris Lobel and co-produced by J.T. Liss ​ Opening Reception ​ Friday, February 13th ​ 6-10pm ​ Cycol Gallery ​ 91 Allen Street, NYC

events.title: Dumpling Date Night
events.description: ​ ​🥟💖 Greetings, Lovestruck Dumpling Devotees! ​ ​DUMPLING DATE NIGHT IS BACCKKKKKK! Get ready to roll into romance at the Dumpling Date Night that's as saucy as our dumplings! Join us for an evening where love steams up, and dumplings are the real heart-fillers. ​ Last Dumpling Date Night, we had 300+ attendees (400 at last year's Valentine's Day singles party). This venue can't fit more than 250 so don't procrastinate! ​ This is a singles party? ​ YES. Come for the singles. Stay because you accidentally ate 14 dumplings and now you can’t leave without rolling yourself home. ​ Is this also for non-single people? ​ YES. It's a celebration of Chinese New Year too! and Valentine's Day! I'm inclusive. But also nosy. ​ Is it anything else? ​ It's a free country. Emotionally? Debatable. ​ ​👭 SPECIAL GUESTS: DJ Cat and her girlfriends are in town, and they’re coming in hot with a dumpling-making plan that’s stuffed with surprises. ​ Expect questionable flirting, high-stakes folding, and at least one person saying, “Wait… is that pork or commitment?” ​ WHERE ​ It's in my new 2 story, 6,000 square ft. Clubhouse in SF! Mingling floor on top. Dance floor on the bottom. ​ ​👗 ATTIRE (STRICTLY ENFORCED) ​ This weekend is a triple threat : Chinese New Year, Valentine’s Day, and the Super Bowl. ​ So yes, we made a dress code that’s as confusing as explaining your relationship status to your aunties. ​ 🔴 Wear RED if you’re single and ready to mingle ​ You’re spicy, you’re bold, you’re the main character — basically Sriracha , but with better boundaries. Come Sira-cha-cha-cha your way into love. ​ ⚫ Wear BLACK if you’re taken and mourning the loss of your freedom ​ We’ve got tissues for your feelings and dumplings to fill the void . (Just kidding. Love is beautiful. Marriage is a group project.) ​ 🟡 Wear GOLD if your relationship status is… “it’s complicated” ​ Gold pairs perfectly with indecision. You’re not single, not taken… you’re... just... limited edition . ​ 🥟 Wear DUMPLING if you want to get in for free ​ Message us and we’ll add you to the VIP list . ​ But listen carefully: if you choose this option, you MUST come dressed as a dumpling or you will not be let in. No costume, no entry. We’re not playing. We’re steaming. ​ 🗓️ AGENDA ​ 7pm – 10pm: Dumpling time + mingling 10pm – 2am: Dancing time + mingling 2am – 3am: Debauchery + mingling (just kidding — it’s usually just drunk people laying on couches like discarded fortune cookies) ​ As you can see, all equations lead to mingling . <3 This isn’t a party. It’s a social experiment with dipping sauce. ​ 🥟 FOOD ​ Dumplings. All night long. Yes, even if you said you “only want two.” We’ve heard that before. ​ 🍸 DRINKS (OPEN BAR) ​ Endless cocktails in many shades of red — because nothing says romance like “I’m blushing” OR “I spilled.” ​ 🎶 MUSIC ​ DJ lineup: ​ SSEDA (8:00 – 9:30) Sol8 (9:30 – 10:50) Cat Liu (10:50 – 12:10) sosicksosad, valouflex, dj danydonowitz (12:10 – 1:30) ​ ​— Spice King http://instagram.com/spicekingofzanzibar ​ ​​Host a party, apply for membership: https://sanfranciscosocial.club

events.title: Selling in the Age of AI: Fireside Chat with Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas and Tech GTM Expert Rich Liu
events.description: ​ AI is revolutionizing how companies are built. Along the way, it’s challenged everything we know about going to market, engaging with customers, and navigating careers. ​ In this exclusive fireside chat, Aravind and Rich will share their hard-won insights on how go-to-market has been upended, what the future of selling looks like, and how to accelerate a career in this age of AI Innovation. ​ About the Speakers ​ Aravind Srinivas is the Cofounder and CEO of Perplexity. Prior to co-founding Perplexity, Aravind served as a research scientist at OpenAI, Google, and DeepMind. His investors and advisors include some of the world’s leading research scientists, top VC’s, and founders of some of the world‘s most transformational companies. Aravind holds a PhD in computer science from UC Berkeley and a Bachelor’s and Master’s in Electrical Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras. ​ Rich Liu is a Strategic Advisor to Perplexity and former CEO of Navan Travel. A biomedical engineer turned CEO/CRO, Rich is renowned for scaling 5 multi-billion dollar unicorns across 3 IPOs, including Navan, MuleSoft/Salesforce, and Meta. His passion is building legendary companies, who fundamentally change the way people live and work. ​ Agenda ​ 5:30 PM - 6:15 PM | Check-in and networking ​ 6:15 PM - 7:00 PM | Fireside chat with Aravind Srinivas and Rich Liu ​ 7:00 PM - 7:45 PM | Networking ​ Light bites and beverages will be provided! ​ Built to unlock the world’s curiosity, Perplexity is the AI-powered answer engine that provides more than 10 billion secure and accurate answers per year to people, companies, finance professionals, shoppers, publishers, students, and decision-makers of all kinds. ​ RSVP & Approval ​ Attendance is limited and subject to approval. Please register to submit your request for attendance.

events.title: AI Journal Club for Researchers ft. ​Ben Coleman (Google Deepmind)
events.description: ​ Join the Workato AI Research Lab for small, discussion-driven sessions with fellow AI researchers. These gatherings will bring together researchers to share recent papers, discuss ongoing work, and exchange perspectives on how AI research is shaping real world systems. The focus is on open dialogue, technical depth, and learning from peers working at the forefront of their field. ​ 6:00-6:30 PM: Check in and registration 6:30-7:15 PM : Talk + Q&A 7:15-8:00 PM : Networking ​ Please arrive by 6:30 PM. Doors will close at this time, and late entry cannot be accommodated to avoid disrupting the event. Featured Speaker ​ Ben Coleman , Research Scientist at Google Deepmind ​ Benjamin Coleman is a senior research scientist at Google DeepMind. He received his PhD from Rice University advised by Anshumali Shrivastava. Ben's research seeks to improve the Pareto frontier for the tradeoffs between ML model performance, data quantity/quantity, and cost. In past years, he studied this problem using techniques from information theory, sampling, and randomized algorithms. More recently, his work focuses on the development of research agents that improve the tradeoffs through the automated discovery of new ML methods. Context Management for Complex Agentic Workflows ​ LLMs have rapidly transitioned from simple dialogue machines into capable agentic systems that execute sequences of actions to pursue complex goals. This shift has enabled the application of LLMs to a much wider set of problems, and LLM agents achieve excellent performance on tasks that can be solved with short sequences of actions. However, LLMs often struggle with tasks that are long-horizon, high-context, and require learning from experience. This limits their ability to repeatedly interact with the environment to solve a task, posing fundamental challenges for LLM-driven scientific experimentation, programming, and research. In this talk, we investigate the reasons why agents fail on complex tasks and propose context management solutions for important failure modes. For example, agents often fail to distill a long experience log into reusable procedural knowledge. We address this problem in our Evo-Memory paper, where we benchmark the agent's ability to learn from experience. To do this, we rephrase existing evals as a stream of tasks where the LLM is allowed to maintain a persistent state between each task. To manipulate and evolve this state, we introduce LLM-driven retrospection techniques (ExpRAG and ReMem), ultimately finding that iterative memory refinement is a critical feature for procedural learning. Next, we turn our attention to evolution agents for hill-climbing problems, where the LLM is asked to iterate on a design based on design quality feedback. In this setting, we find that LLMs suffer from pathological context-conditioning effects: they often propose ideas similar to those already in context. This prevents adequate exploration of the solution space and results in a negative feedback loop where each idea strongly conditions the generation of similar follow-up ideas. We develop an evolution framework (PACEvolve) that breaks this loop with context-sampling mechanisms to enable backtracking and hierarchical memory management. By addressing the underlying context-conditioning problem, PACEvolve attains SOTA results on benchmarks such as NanoGPT and KernelBench. Finally, we briefly discuss the promise and limitations of context management as a general tool to fix behavioral problems in LLM agents. ​ Who Should Attend AI Researchers and practitioners working at the intersection of AI research and real world systems ​ Hosted by Workato ​ ​Workato is an enterprise automation and integration platform that orchestrates workflows across applications, data, and systems enabling secure, governed execution of complex processes as organizations adopt AI agents at scale. You can explore Workato's end-to-end capabilities here.

events.title: Highs, Lows, and Mania: The Science of Creativity
events.description: ​🧠 Is the “mad genius” a myth—or a scientific reality? ​From Ancient Greece to modern pop culture, creativity has long been linked to emotional extremes. But what does science actually say about the relationship between mood and creative thinking? ​Join Sheri Johnson , Distinguished Professor of Psychology at University of California, Berkeley and Director of the Cal Mania (CALM) Program, for a fascinating look at how our emotional lives shape creativity. Drawing on decades of research, Dr. Johnson explores how everyday mood shifts—as well as experiences like depression and mania—can influence different kinds of creative work. ​Along the way, she’ll share what this research reveals about nurturing creativity in real life—from understanding your emotional rhythms to supporting well-being, sleep, and healthy habits. Whether you’re an artist, thinker, or simply curious about your own mind, this talk offers science-backed insights into how mood and creativity intertwine. 🎨✨ ​🕰 Event Details ​ ​​ What should I expect? ​7:00-7:40 --> arrival & chats ​​​​7:40-8:20 --> lecture ​​​​8:20-9:00 --> q&a and more chatting ​ ​​ Who's invited? ​​​Anyone with an interest in learning new things, meeting new people, and doing fun things on weeknights! Lots of people came solo to our last event, so don't be afraid to do the same—you’ll meet some awesome people! ​ ​​ What about parking? ​​​There's no parking on-site, so we recommend street parking or using public transportation. ​Do I have to be 21+? ​​No :) This venue is open to all ages. If you'd like to purchase alcohol, you must be 21+ and present a valid ID. ​Will this event be photographed or recorded? ​Photos and short video clips may be taken for promotional purposes. By attending, you consent to being photographed or recorded. We do not do full recordings of lectures at this time. ​🔔 Stay in the Loop ​​​​​I can't make it to this event. How do I stay updated for future events? ​​​📧 Join our mailing list ​​​📸 Follow our Instagram ​ ​​​​ How do I become a speaker? ​​​Fill out this form and we'll reach out to you if we think your lecture is a good fit! 👉 Speaker form ​🧾 Policies ​ ​ The lecture is sold out! Can I join a waitlist? ​​Unfortunately, Luma does NOT support waitlists for paid events yet. We recommend checking back on the event site the day before / the day of the event! Attendees are likely to drop out. ​ ​​ What about refunds? ​You can refund your ticket up to 24 hours before the event starts. Since this is a limited-space event, we encourage you to update your RSVP if you can’t make it—this helps us keep spots open for others. NOTE - you do NOT need to email us for a refund, we will issue one within 48 hours upon changing your RSVP to "Not Going" :) ​What about accessibility? ​​​We want our lectures to be as accessible as possible. Accessibility can vary depending on the space, so please research our specific venue to learn more about things like wheelchair access and service animal policies. If you have any accessibility needs not covered here, please email us at hello@bigbrainlectures.com and we’ll do our best to support you. ​ ​ What about the ticket structure? ​​Every ticket sold goes directly back into the business. However, we want to make our events accessible to everyone. If cost is a barrier, please reach out for financial assistance by emailing hello@bigbrainlectures.com.​ ​What about email updates? ​By registering for this event, you’ll be added to the Big Brain mailing list and receive occasional updates about future lectures and events. You can unsubscribe at any time. ​🧠 Community Guidelines ​Big Brain events are designed to be welcoming, curious, and respectful spaces for learning and connection. ​By attending, you agree to treat speakers, staff, venue employees, and fellow attendees with respect and to follow all venue rules and staff instructions. ​ Harassment, disruptive behavior, or excessive intoxication will not be tolerated. events.title: Consciousness, Intelligence & Spirituality with Swami Sarvapriyananda
events.description: ​ South Park Commons is delighted to host Swami Sarvapriyananda for a lecture, discussion, and Q&A on The Culmination of All Knowledge including the nature of consciousness, the limit of intelligence, and how spirituality intersects within the current state of AI. ​ ​​​​​ Event Details ​ ​​​​​​​4:30pm: Doors Open ​ ​​​​5:00-6:00pm: Lecture & Discussion with Swami Sarvapriyananda ​ Swami Sarvapriyananda has been the Minister and spiritual leader of the Vedanta Society of New York since January 2017. He joined the Ramakrishna Math in 1994 and received sannyasa in 2004. He served as an acharya (teacher) of the monastic probationers’ training center at Belur Math, India. He also served in various capacities in different educational institutes of the Ramakrishna Mission in India and as the Assistant Minister of the Vedanta Society of Southern California. Swami Sarvapriyananda is also a prolific writer and speaker whose works make the insights of Advaita Vedanta accessible to modern audiences. His publications include Mahavakya: The Essence of Vedanta, Fullness & Emptiness: Vedanta and Buddhism, and From Illusion to Infinity: Discovering the Self . The more recent book Conversations on Vedanta in Practice is a curated collection of question and answer sessions with the Swami, on topics of practical importance. The wide range of his writings reflect his deep engagement with comparative philosophy and the application of Vedantic wisdom in daily life. He has also contributed essays and research papers on the Upanishads, the Bhagavad Gita, and the philosophy of consciousness. ​ About South Park Commons (SPC) ​ ​​​​​​SPC is a technical community and venture fund dedicated to helping founders, researchers, and technologists figure out what to work on next—what we call the -1 to 0 stage of your career. We believe this is best accomplished in the most talent-dense community possible. ​ ​​​​​​ If you are exploring what's next, we encourage you to apply to SPC. ​ *Please note doors close at event start time and we are unable to accommodate late arrivals.

events.title: AI Healthtech Night | Anthropic, DigitalOcean, & Workato
events.location: Workato, Chloe Condon, Lizzie Siegle, TheAgentic & 1 otherSan Francisco, California
events.description: ​ Join our DigitalOcean, Anthropic, and Workato Agentic Healthtech Night meetup! Featured Speakers - Chloe Condon , Developer Advocate at Workato - Lizzie Siegle , Developer Advocate at DigitalOcean - Martin Amps , Member of Technical Staff at Anthropic ​ Please arrive by 6:30 PM. Doors will close at this time, and late entry cannot be accommodated to avoid disrupting the event. ​ ​ Who Should Attend AI builders curious about how AI is being used in healthtech. Come ready to chat and learn from 3 AI healthtech talks/demos! ​ There will be food and drinks! Hosted by Workato ​ ​Workato is an enterprise automation and integration platform that orchestrates workflows across applications, data, and systems enabling secure, governed execution of complex processes as organizations adopt AI agents at scale. You can explore Workato's end-to-end capabilities here. ​ In Collaboration W/ ​ ​ DigitalOcean's Gradient AI platform lets you automate RAG pipelines. Upload different files or input URLs and then they'll be automatically crawled, scraped, embedded, and stored so you can search and chat with them! ​ ​​ TheAgentic provides complete infrastructure for production-ready AI agents, currently powering companies in biotech, healthtech, cybersecurity, and fintech where accuracy isn't optional. Symbolic Fusion is their latest release: an ecosystem of products that fuses neuro-symbolic precision with LLM flexibility— infrastructure that used to require a massive team and budget. The Launchpad program partners with early-stage startups to build AI products on their infrastructure at zero cost and zero equity. Selective admission. Chat with their team to learn more.

events.title: DevEx demo night
events.description: ​ Great developer tools don't just solve problems, they disappear into your workflow. But building products that developers actually want to use requires obsessive attention to experience, performance and trust. ​ Join Browserbase, Mintlify, WorkOS, and incident.io for an evening of demos and conversation about what it takes to build developer tools that scale. ​ Each company will share a 10-minute demo of something they've recently shipped, followed by a quick q&a. ​ About the demo companies: ​ BrowserBase - Headless browser infrastructure that lets developers run reliable browser automation at scale without managing infrastructure ​ CopilotKit - CopilotKit is the Agentic Application Framework: the easiest way to build AI copilots into your app, with support to connect any LLM or build with any agent framework ​ Mintlify - AI-powered documentation platform that turns code into beautiful, searchable docs that stay in sync with your product ​ WorkOS - Developer platform powering Enterprise Ready auth, identity, and security for Al apps. ​ incident.io - Helps engineering teams respond to and learn from incidents, minimise downtime, and focus on solving the problems that matter ​ Agenda 6:00 pm — Food, drinks and welcome 6:45 pm — Demos begin 8:00 pm — Chat and chill 9:00 pm — Wrap up

events.title: Women Founders Pitch Night
events.description: ​Join us for Women Founders Pitch Night , hosted by Mariane Bekker from Founders Bay , where visionary women founders take the stage to showcase innovative, impact-driven startups. This event highlights female-led companies across technology, AI, deep tech, and frontier industries that are solving real-world challenges and shaping the future. ​ Apply to pitch HERE ​Selected startups will pitch live to a distinguished panel of venture capitalists and technology leaders, sharing their mission, traction, and vision in a fast-paced, interactive format. Each pitch is followed by thoughtful, actionable feedback from judges—offering founders valuable insights, visibility, and direct investor perspective. ​Finalists will compete for the opportunity to win funding, mentorship, and increased visibility within the startup ecosystem. ​Winner Benefits ​ 6-month VIP access to Founders Bay Private membership ​ Featured spotlight in the Founders Bay newsletter reaching 150,000+ founders and VCs ​ ​Agenda ​​ 5:00pm - 6:30pm: Dinner & Networking ​​ 6:30pm - 7:30pm: Startups Pitch ​​ Judges ​ Vidya Raman , Partner, FirstByte Ventures ​ Danielle Pettee , Founder, Get Pitched Agency ​ Assel Seitova , Founder, Sisters - Female Founders Initiative ​ Lidia Schwarz , Senior Operations & Innovation Lead, INNOVIT - Italian Innovation and Culture Hub ​​ 7:30pm - 8pm: Private Meet & Greet with the Judges for VIP Ticket Holders Only ​About Us ​ Perkins Coie is a trusted advisor to innovative companies throughout their lifecycle. As they build and scale, we support clients with comprehensive legal and business counseling from formation to exit, including equity and growth financings, corporate governance, commercial contracts, intellectual property strategy, and labor and employment matters. Our lawyers have managed thousands of venture capital and private equity financings, from pre-seed to growth-stage, for both startups and investors. Our national presence and extensive corporate law experience, combined with sector-specific knowledge, ensure our services are tailored to each client's unique needs, investor expectations, and growth trajectories in cutting-edge industries like artificial intelligence, blockchain and other fintech, digital health, gaming, cleantech, digital media, and consumer packaged goods. ​​ Sisters is a female founders community empowering women founders from Central Asia to build globally competitive startups. We connect founders to Silicon Valley expertise, capital, and networks through curated events, mentorship, and pitch opportunities. ​​ Please join our community . | Follow us on IG & Linkedin | ​​📧 femalefounders.centralasia@gmail.com ​​​​​​ Founders Bay is a membership community of 150,000+ founders, executives, investors and operators coming together to grow their market through curated weekly events, expert-led virtual workshops, mentorship programs and educational resources. Proudly woman-owned and operated by Mariane Bekker , we are dedicated to empowering a diverse and inclusive startup ecosystem. Subscribe to our newsletter and become a member today to unlock more content and exclusive perks. Join our community here | Follow us on IG & Linkedin ​​​​By registering for this event, you agree to release Founders Bay Inc. from all liability related to the event. You also consent to be subscribed to the Founders Bay newsletter for updates on future workshops, events, and resources. You may unsubscribe at any time.

events.title: SF Hardware & Manufacturing Happy Hour
events.description: ​ We’re kicking off 2026 with a no-nonsense happy hour for builders in San Francisco! Hardware FYI and Fictiv are bringing together engineers, industry leaders, and startup founders — a chance to talk shop with people who live and breathe the physical world. ​ Applications are open – engineers, leaders, and founders are all welcome! Once your RSVP is confirmed, we’ll share the event location. ​ About Hardware FYI ​ Hardware FYI is a weekly newsletter for engineers, founders, and operators building at the intersection of hardware and manufacturing. We cover the latest in engineering and startup funding, with technical insights trusted by 17,750+ subscribers. ​ About Fictiv ​ Fictiv is a global manufacturing and supply chain company accelerating innovation for hardware teams. Through a powerful combination of digital infrastructure, advanced manufacturing capabilities, and a network of globally distributed, highly vetted partners, Fictiv enables fast, high-quality production of custom mechanical parts. From early-stage prototyping to production at scale, Fictiv supports innovators across robotics, aerospace, medical devices, and clean energy. With over 35 million parts delivered and, now, as part of the MISUMI Group, Fictiv is building the future of custom and standard mechanical parts through one unified platform. Whether you're a startup founder or a seasoned hardware engineer, Fictiv helps you move from idea to impact—faster.

events.title: AI Philosophy Nights: Invention of Tomorrow
events.description: ​ Join us in this kick-off event of our monthly AI Philosophy Nights where we attempt communal sense-making. ​ Each month, we will bring together philosophers, historians, technologists, and social scientists for a high-level fireside chat, followed by small-group salon style discussions. ​ First Session: The Invention of Tomorrow ​ In this opening event, our founder Banu Kellner sits down with Tamim Ansary , award-winning author of The Invention of Yesterday . In his book Tamim traced how shared narratives wove the tapestry of human history, in this session we'll discuss the narratives of today weaving the future. ​ What story are we really in the middle of now? ​ 6:30-7:00pm Doors Open . Drinks & delicious bites will be served. Doors will be closed at 7pm. ​ 7:00-7:45pm Fireside Chat . Banu & Tamim will discuss how stories shape our reality and what stories we are telling ourselves around AI. ​ 8:00-8:45pm Small Group Discussions . Break into small-group conversations to grapple with these questions together. ​ 9:00-9:30pm Whole Group Conversation. We will come back together to share insights and further questions. ​ ~~~ ​ Tamim Ansary is the acclaimed author of The Invention of Yesterday and Destiny Disrupted , covering world history through the narratives of civilizations. He is also known for one of the internet's first major viral phenomena. In 2001, an email he sent to 20 friends titled "An Open Letter to America" circulated globally within days, reaching an estimated tens of millions of people. ​ Banu Kellner is an executive coach to Founder/CEOs building frontier technologies across AI, and biotech. She is the author of the Superhumanist Manifesto and the founder of the SuperHuman Society , an organization focused on championing a future where technology expands human dignity, capability, and connection. ​ Sponsored by Imbue . Empowering humans in an age of AI by building tools that give every person the power to shape their digital world.

AI Meets Robotics – Launch & Fund Your Own Startup (Edition 1)
events.description: ​ The official AI Meets Robotics – Launch & Fund Your Own Startup (Edition-1) hackathon will take place on February 14–15, 2026 in San Francisco, CA , as the on-site finale of an eight-day global hybrid program. In the days leading up to the event, teams build remotely, validate their ideas, and prepare investor-ready demos before coming together in SF. ​ Participants will explore AI + robotics through hands-on challenges and mentorship opportunities. Projects will focus on building software-only robotics products in simulation or as devtools: autonomy and planning in digital environments, operator dashboards and fleet control, orchestration platforms, and analytics or infrastructure for robotics teams - with no physical hardware required. ​ Backed by partners such as Surge, Google, Google DeepMind and lablab.ai , the hackathon will reward creativity and execution through on-site pitching opportunities and follow-on support for selected teams. The most impactful teams will be invited to participate in person in San Francisco to present their work, connect with mentors, and plug into a broader 🏆 $1,000,000+ pool of credits, token prizes, perks, and funding opportunities across the Launch & Fund Your Own Startup series. ​ Location San Francisco, California, USA Please note: On-site capacity is limited. Priority access will be given to selected teams. Travel and accommodation will not be covered .

events.title: Build What You Love - Women in Tech Hackathon
events.location: Ko, Victor Su-Ortiz, Smitha SL & Sahar MorSan Francisco, California
events.description: ​ Following a series of successful community-first hackathons, we’re hosting the largest hybrid AI hackathon for women and nonbinary folks in tech — with in-person attendance in the Bay Area and a fully supported virtual experience. ​ We’re proud to be supported by Replit, Vercel, Daytona, MiniMax, and BEM , helping make this an accessible, high-impact build experience for our community. ​ 💡 What to Expect ​ Hands-on workshops and mentorship from industry leaders and AI practitioners ​ A high-energy demo session judged by top founders, operators, and technologists ​ Prizes, recognition, and opportunities to showcase your work ​ A welcoming, collaborative environment designed to support builders at every stage ​ 🏆 The Grand Prize ​ The winning team will receive a one-of-one, custom-designed jewelry piece by celebrity jeweler Kyle Chan , created exclusively for this hackathon. ​ Kyle Chan’s work has been worn by Beyoncé, featured in La La Land on Emma Stone, and showcased across Vanderpump Rules and RHOBH. The piece is handcrafted in Los Angeles and designed as both a collectible trophy and a lasting symbol of what you built — something you won’t find anywhere else. ​ 🚀 Why Join? ​ Turn ideas into real prototypes, level up your skills, and meet people who genuinely support your growth. Whether this is your first AI project or your tenth, this hackathon is built to inspire, empower, and celebrate women and allies in tech. ​ 🌟 Join us and build what you love — at the Bay Area’s largest women-led AI hackathon. ​ 🔗 More details: https://womenintechhack.com AI Valley is a community rooted in supporting exceptional first-generation builders, founders, and creators. We curate environments where ambitious people meet collaborators, mentors, and opportunities through hackathons, workshops, and intimate gatherings across AI, tech, and the arts. If you care about who you build with as much as what you build, this is your place. ​ 🌐 Website: https://aivalley.io ​ 📅 Events: https://lu.ma/aivalley ​ 👥 Community (Discord): https://discord.gg/QESCnSUPC9 ​ 📰 Newsletter: https://aivalleyio.substack.com ​ 🔗 All links: https://aivalley.io/links

events.title: Agentic + AI Observability Meetup SF
events.description: ​ Join us for Agentic + AI Observability meetup on Tuesday . February 17 from 5pm - 8pm PST at the Databricks SF office , an evening focused on agentic architectures and AI observability: how to design, ship, and monitor AI agents that actually work in production. ​ This meetup is built for engineers, ML practitioners, and AI startup founders who are already experimenting with agents (or planning to) and want to go deeper into the tech. We’ll cover real-world patterns, failure modes, and tooling for building reliable agentic systems in the broader open-source ecosystem. ​ Whether you’re at an early-stage startup or an established company, if you care about getting AI agents into production, and keeping them healthy, this meetup is for you.​ ​ Why you should attend ​ See real architectures: Learn how teams are designing agentic systems on top of data/feature platforms, retrieval, and tools, not just calling a single LLM endpoint.​ ​ Learn how to observe what agents are doing: Go beyond logs and dashboards to structured traces, evals, and metrics that help you understand and improve agent behavior over time.​ ​ Get hands-on with MLflow and observability tools: Watch live demos of MLflow, tracing integrations, and evaluation workflows for agentic systems.​ ​ Connect with other builders: Meet engineers, founders, and practitioners working on similar problems, swap patterns, and find collaborators and potential hires.​ ​ Agenda ​ 5:00pm: Registration/Mingling ​ 6:00pm: Welcome Remarks by Jules Damj, Databricks, Staff Developer Advocate ​ 6:15pm : Talk #1 - Building Trustworthy, High-Quality AI Agents with MLflow ​ 6:45pm: Talk #2 - Evaluating AI in Production: A Practical Guide ​ 7:15pm: Mingling with bites + dessert ​ 8:00pm: Night Ends ​ Speakers ​ Corey Zumar ​ Databricks ​ Staff Software Engineer ​ Mengying Li ​ Braintrust ​ Head of Data & Product Growth ​ Session Descriptions ​ Building Trustworthy, High-Quality AI Agents with MLflow ​ Building trustworthy, high-quality agents remains one of the hardest problems in AI today. Even as coding assistants automate parts of the development workflow, evaluating, observing, and improving agent quality is still manual, subjective, and time-consuming. Teams spend hours “vibe checking” agents, labeling outputs, and debugging failures. But it doesn’t have to be this slow or tedious. In this session, you’ll learn how to use MLflow to automate and accelerate agent observability for quality improvement, applying proven patterns to deliver agents that behave reliably in real-world conditions. ​ Key Takeaways and Learnings ​ Understand the development lifecycle of Agent development for better observability ​ Use MLflow key components along the development lifecycle to enhance general observability: tracking and debugging, evaluation with MLflow judges, and a prompt registry for versioning ​ Select appropriately from a suite of over 60+ built-in and custom MLflow judges for evaluation, and use Judge Builder for automatic evaluation. ​ Use MLflow UI to compare and comprehend evaluation scores and metrics ​ Evaluating AI in Production: A Practical Guide ​ Evaluations are essential for shipping reliable AI products, but many teams struggle to move beyond manual testing. In this talk, I'll walk through how to build a production-ready evaluation framework — from choosing the right metrics and creating effective test cases to setting up continuous evaluation pipelines that catch issues before your users do. You'll walk away with practical patterns you can apply right away.

ny--new-york.description: ​ Please join us at Data Driven NYC #120 Data Driven NYC - now on Luma! - is the biggest and longest running data and AI meetup in the country. Since 2012, Data Driven NYC has been bringing the best speakers in the data, machine learning, and AI world to NYC. Prior speakers include the CEOs of Snowflake, Databricks, Datadog, MongoDB, the Chief AI Scientist at Meta (Yann LeCun), and many more. We're excited to bring together this vibrant community for the next generation of data and AI builders and leaders. ​ ​ Event #120 Highlights: ​ [Presentation] Neil Zeghidour, Co-Founder & CEO, Gradium - the voice layer for modern applications and AI agents. ​ [Presentation] Rob Cheung, Co-Founder & CEO, Zo Computer - an intelligent cloud computer with built-in AI that lets you turn your ideas into reality fast. ​ [Presentation] Andrew Pignanelli, Co-Founder & CEO, The General Intelligence Company of New York - building highly-capable AI agents to run entire businesses autonomously. ​ ​ Entry Instructions: ​ ​Government issued photo ID is required to attend. The name on your registration must match your ID. ​ ​Doors close at 7pm or at capacity

ny--new-york.title: THE BRIDGE - NYFW EDITION

Business Insider dubbed him the " Gatsby of Silicon Alley. With banking set up in minutes, 2% cashback cards, and powerful tools for managing spend, paying bills, and closing the books, Rho helps high-growth startups move fast and stay focused—with support that goes to the ends of the earth to help you win. ​ Till CFO provides top-tier fractional financial leadership, day-to-day financial operations (accounting, FP&A, etc.), and CFO advisory to early-stage SaaS, AI, FinTech, and Services businesses. They tailor their services to align with each client’s unique needs, delivering expert financial stewardship to founders, CEOs, and operators at the Seed stage and beyond. ​ Schedule a free 1-hour session with Till's Founder & CEO, Bo Weathersbee, a 5x founder and seasoned CFO. ny--new-york.title: Somartica
ny--new-york.description: ​ Somartica: Where movement meets creativity & Presence meets play ​ What happens when adults remember their most embodied, creative selves? ​ Join us for an evening where meditation melts into movement , movement makes way to art , and before you know it, you're drawing on the walls, rolling on the ground belly laughing , and connecting with yourself and others in true authenticity and joy . ​ Somartica blends somatics with art through research-backed methods that help quiet your mind , settle your nervous system , and get you into flow . ​ No performance. No perfection. Just presence and play . ​ The evening’s journey: ✨ A grounding meditation to help you arrive and land 🌀 Intuitive, guided movement to awaken your body’s innate intelligence 🎨 Creative expression through all manner of materials (Crayons! Paint! Yarn! Etc!) 🤸🏽‍♀️ Pure, unscripted play where we find ourselves + one another 🌿 A closing circle to help integrate the magic ​ Consider this your permission slip to be totally who you are ... and surrounded by people doing the same. ❣️ ​ What people are saying: "Somartica is a blast. " "I was out of my head and in a silly flow state the whole time!" ​ No experience necessary. Whether you're a seasoned artist and mover or total beginner, you are welcome. ​ Can't wait to see you! ​ Wear clothes you can move in. ​ Led By: Nasimeh Be ​ Nasimeh Be is an artist, facilitator, and coach with a decade of experience blending mindfulness, mental health, and creativity. Her work has been featured in venues as varied as the Walt Disney Concert Hall, Buzzfeed, and The Rumpus. A trained yoga teacher, improviser, and coach, Nasimeh brings her deep knowledge of mindfulness and play to create transformative, joyful experiences. ​ She is currently pursuing an M.A. in Spiritual Psychology at Columbia. You are welcome to find out more about her across social media: @NasimehBE ​ ​*** ​ Come Early to Elevate Your Experience with Adaptogenic Foods and Teas ​ Reforesters Laboratory is an experimental adaptogenic cafe and sound clinic located in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. We utilize music – including spatial, sub-bass-centered, and organic instrumentation – along with breathwork, meditation, art, plant care and adaptogenic, nutritional foods + beverages to cultivate kindness—both physical and spiritual. We aim to create an environment that offers peace, space, and clarity, helping people understand the connections between themselves, their communities, and the world around them. To that end, we offer affordable "pay what you can" ticket options on all events and classes.

ny--new-york.title: From Engineer to Founder: Building and Selling Developer Tools with Extend & Authzed

ny--new-york.description: ​ Cofounders.nyc & Work-Bench are excited to host a fireside chat with Kushal Byatnal, Co-Founder & CEO of Extend , and Jake Moshenko , Co-Founder & CEO of Authzed for an intimate night of lessons learned and the future of agentic software. ​ We’ll go deep on Extend & Authzed's founding stories, Kushal and Jake's transitions from engineer to founder, and the lessons learned along the way from finding product-market fit and cracking go-to-market, to fundraising and building with AI inside a complex enterprise landscape. Expect candid insights, honest tradeoffs, and plenty of room for discussion. ​ This is a small, curated gathering designed to foster real conversation and high-signal connections with other NYC founders and operators building ambitious companies. ​ 🗓️ Wednesday February 11th 🕰️ 6:00PM – 8:00PM ET 📍 In-person, NYC (location shared upon confirmation) ​ Space is limited — please register and we’ll follow up to confirm your spot. ​ This event is brought to you by: Extend : Extend is an AI-native document processing infrastructure company helping ambitious technical teams transform unstructured documents into high-quality structured data with accuracy and speed. Their platform provides a complete suite of APIs and tooling for parsing, extraction, classification, and workflow orchestration, enabling engineers to build and deploy production-ready document workflows in days. Extend works with cutting-edge companies across industries to accelerate product roadmaps and unlock the full value of mission-critical data. They've raised $17M from investors like Innovation Endeavors, Homebrew, and Guillermo Rauch. ​ AuthZed is on a mission to fix access control by providing authorization infrastructure. AuthZed provides one authorization system for your entire application ecosystem, eliminating authorization silos and simplifying your architecture with a centralized permissions platform. Trusted by developer and platform teams at OpenAI, Workday, National Bank of Canada, Turo, Neo Financial and more. ​ Work-Bench : We are an early stage enterprise software VC fund based in New York City. We lead $3M - $6M Seed rounds in SaaS and infrastructure startups, focus on supporting companies’ 0 to 1 go-to-market journeys, and have built a dynamic enterprise tech community here in NYC. We’re investing out of our $160M Fund IV, and notable portfolio companies include Cockroach Labs, Socure, Spring Health, and Dialpad. cofounders.nyc is a curated community for NYC's top builders. The goal is to connect top operators, so you can build the next big thing. Whether you're looking for a co-founder or early teammate, cofounders.nyc is here to help. cofounders.nyc is run by Danny Chesley . ​ Ramp is the leading financial management platform (cards, bill pay, T&E, and treasury) to help startups stretch their runway and scale efficiently. VC-backed founders use Ramp to cut their costs and spend smarter with real-time visibility & tight control over every dollar, saving ~5% on all expenses. Through our partnership with Ramp, your team receives: ​ $1,000 sign-up bonus ​ $350K+ in startup perks, including credits from AWS, Azure, Cognition, OpenAI, Notion, and more ​ White-glove onboarding support and expedited underwriting ​ To Redeem: sign up here .

ny--new-york.description: ​ 🧘‍♀️ BAD BUNNY FLOW - Vinyasa Refresh + Jazz Social ​ 🎷 ​ 🎶 Flowing vinyasa practice set to Bad Bunny + live jazz after 🌊 Style: All levels flow (accessible and revivifying) 🙏 No yoga experience needed. Ideal for beginners and experienced yogis. We mean it!! ​ 📣 How to Sign Up Register on Luma and present your ticket at the door. Or just walk in. We always love our walk ins (pay by credit card). BYOM (Bring Your Own Mat) or rent one from us for $5. ​ 📍 Where & When Time: Doors open at 6:30 PM. The meeting begins once the room fills, usually about 15 to 20 minutes after. The yoga practice runs for about one hour. Live jazz schmooze follows. ​ 🌿 What to Expect We are a club, not a class. Come as you are, say hello to the people around you, and settle in. ​ This Bad Bunny Flow is part of our Vinyasa Refresh series and runs about an hour. Expect to move and breathe through an energizing set of standing postures and rejuvenating poses on the floor, all set to Bad Bunny tracks that keep the flow fun and grounded. ​ We understand that life happens. Sometimes that means showing up late, in your PJs, or both. We leave some time at the beginning of our meetings to ease in and socialize. ​ 🎷 After Yoga Stick around. There will be live jazz downstairs and a cash bar with snacks for us to enjoy after practice. ​ ⭐ Our Instructor Dan Sohval came to yoga seeking ways to build inner discipline and mental balance. He is the founder of Yoga Club, which has grown to over 1500 members since launching in 2025. A lifelong educator, he brings to his instruction the same humor and curiosity that guides his teaching in the classroom. He received his 200 hour certification at VeraYoga with additional training in yin and trauma informed practices. Off the mat, he is a published author, teaches computer science, and is an avid fan of Korean food. ​ 💫 About Yoga Club We bring people together through high quality, affordable yoga and community. We meet in creative spaces around the city to move, breathe, and meet new people.

Click the link below to participate. ​ https://go.rallyup.com/createwithintenton ​ YOUR HOST ​ Tony Henry - Founder and CEO of 99 YARDS ​ ​ ​ Britta (Sautter) Cabanos - Founder | Fashion Educator & Community Builder ​ ​ Brand Panel : Sustainable Fashion in Practice ​ Hear from sustainability-driven fashion brands as they share their journeys, challenges, and approaches to building intentional collections and responsible production models. ​ Moderate by Karen Zhang ​ ​ Karen Zhang is a product marketing leader and advisor specializing in fashion and consumer technology.
